009package imagingbook.common.geometry.line;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import java.util.Locale;
014
015import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
016import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
017import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
018
019/**
020 * This class represents a line in parametric form: 
021 * x = s + t v, where s is a start point on the line,
022 * v is a direction vector, and t is a real variable.
023 * Instances are immutable.
024 * TODO: add implementation of Curve2d
025 *
026 */
027public class ParametricLine {
028        
029        private final double[] s, v;
030        
031        public ParametricLine(double[] s, double[] v) {
032                if (s.length != 2 || v.length != 2) {
033                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("vectors s, v must be of length 2");
034                }
035                if (Arithmetic.isZero(Matrix.normL2squared(v))) {
036                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("direction vector (v) must be nonzero");
037                }
038                this.s = s.clone();
039                this.v = v.clone();
040        }
041        
042        public double[] getS() {
043                return s;
044        }
045
046        public double[] getV() {
047                return v;
048        }
049        
050        // --------------------------
051        
052        public static ParametricLine from(AlgebraicLine al) {
053                double[] p = al.getParameters();
054                // not needed, since algebraic lines are always normalized (i.e. A^2 + B^2 = 1)
055                double norm2 = sqr(p[0]) + sqr(p[1]);           // = A^2 + B^2
056                double scale = -p[2] / norm2;                           // = -C / ||(A,B)||^2
057                double[] s = {scale * p[0], scale * p[1]};      // = (-CA, -CB)
058                double[] v = {-p[1], p[0]};                                     // = (-B, A)
059                return new ParametricLine(s, v);
060        }
061        
062        @Override
063        public String toString() {
064                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s <s=[%.3f, %.3f], v=[%.3f, %.3f]>",
065                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), s[0], s[1], v[0], v[1]);
066        }
067        
068        // --------------------------
069        
070        public static void main (String[] args) {
071                Pnt2d p1 = Pnt2d.from(1, 2);
072                Pnt2d p2 = Pnt2d.from(4, 3);
073                AlgebraicLine al1 = AlgebraicLine.from(p1, p2);
074                System.out.println("al1 = " + al1);
075                ParametricLine pl = ParametricLine.from(al1);
076                System.out.println("pl = " + pl);
077                AlgebraicLine al2 = AlgebraicLine.from(pl);
078                System.out.println("al2 = " + al2);
079                System.out.println("al1 = al2 ? " + al1.equals(al2));
080        }
081
082        /*
083        al1 = AlgebraicLine <a=-0.316, b=0.949, c=-1.581>
084        pl = ParametricLine <s=[-0.500, 1.500], v=[-0.949, -0.316]>
085        al2 = AlgebraicLine <a=0.316, b=-0.949, c=1.581>
086        al1 = al2 ? true
087        */
088
089}
